intro: Pentzia annua, commonly known as the annual pentzia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassland habitats. Pentzia annua is an annual species, completing its life cycle within a single growing season.
